Dear Mrs. Prudhomme:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a youth
on any part of their body
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth report staff are assaultive outside the facility where there
are no cameras.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant 1 and Complainant 2 were attempted to be
contacted on 3/18/2024 and 4/17/2024 however were unable to
be reached.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/20/2024. Youth A reported she was recently in a fight at the
facility with Youth B and Youth C. Youth A reported staff
intervened appropriately to keep her, Youth B, and Youth C safe
during the fight as Staff 1 intervened by placing his body in
between Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C. Youth A reported she,
Youth B, and Youth C were placed in restraints to stop the fight.
Youth A had no concerns with the facility or concerns about staff
abusing youth outside where there were no cameras.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/20/2024. Youth B reported she recently got in a fight with Youth
2

A. Youth B reported during the fight, Staff 1 stopped her by
“slamming” her into the car. Youth B demonstrated “slamming” by
Staff 1 having his arms out to his side and using his body and
arms to get Youth B back into the car. Youth B reported she was
restrained by Staff 5 during the fight and escorted back to the
house. Youth B reported she felt staff did their best to keep Youth
A, Youth B, and Youth C safe. Youth B shared concerns of Staff 1
grabbing onto her sweatshirt one time when Youth B was running
out of bounds. Staff 1 held on to her sweatshirt as he escorted
her back to the house. Youth B reported she does not like when
male staff place her in restraints as the male’s genitals touch her
butt which triggers her. Youth B reported no other concerns at the
facility and reported she likes the facility. Youth B had no concerns
with the facility or concerns about staff abusing youth outside
where there are no cameras. Youth B reported she liked being at
the facility.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/20/2024. Youth C reported she was recently in a fight with
Youth A. Staff 1 placed Youth C in a restraint. Youth C was
unable to describe how she was restrained. Staff 3 came to
assist, and restrained Youth A. Youth C reported she thinks staff
did the best they could to try to stop Youth A, Youth B, and Youth
C from fighting. Youth C had no concerns with the facility or
concerns about staff abusing youth outside where there were no
cameras.
Youth D was interviewed via telephone on 4/15/2024. Youth D
witnessed a fight between Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C. Youth
D recalled Youth C saying Staff 1 was on her hair during the
restraint at which time Staff 1 said he was sorry and was not trying
to be. Youth D reported she felt staff did all they could to keep
Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C safe. Youth D did not have any
additional concerns with staff being abusive toward youth.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/20/2024. Staff 1 was working on the day Youth A, Youth B, and
Youth C got into an altercation at the facility. Staff 1 described
how he used proximity control to intervene during the fight and
used his body to separate Youth A, Youth B, and Youth C. Staff 1
used proximity control with his arms out to his side to keep Youth
B and Youth C from getting to Youth A and used his body as he
stepped toward the car to get Youth B and Youth C back toward
the car. Staff 1 denied “slamming” Youth B into the car at any
time. Staff 1 was asked about an incident Youth B talked about
regarding Staff 1 grabbing ahold of Youth B’s sweatshirt on a
3

separate occasion. Staff 1 reported the previous week Youth B
went out of bounds as Youth B had asked to do one thing and
then went out of the house in the opposite direction of the agreed
upon plan with Staff 1. Staff 1 addressed with Youth B that they
had made a plan and were going to do what was agreed upon and
Youth B took off running. Staff 1 reported he was running to catch
up to Youth B and grabbed on to Youth B’s sweatshirt on the
shoulder area and told Youth B to stop. Staff 1 reported he fell to
the ground and Youth B stopped running. Staff 1 reported he got
off the ground and “escorted” Youth B back to the house by
holding her sweatshirt sleeve. Staff 1 described holding Youth B’s
sweatshirt sleeve as Youth B had pulled her arm out of her
sweatshirt sleeve and Staff 1 held the end of Youth B’s empty
sweatshirt sleeve. Youth B walked back willingly with Staff 1.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/28/2024. Staff 2 reported she was working on the day Youth A,
Youth B, and Youth C got into a fight. Staff 2 reported staff
intervened to stop the youth from fighting and had no concerns
regarding staff intervening. Staff 2 felt staff did all they could to
keep youth separated during the fight. Staff 2 had no concerns
with the restraints she witnessed. Staff 2 did not have any
concerns regarding staff assaulting youth off camera.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/20/2024. Staff 3 was working in Sherk house when there was a
second call for extra staff to assist due to a fight between Youth A,
Youth B, and Youth C. Staff 3 responded and reported staff were
attempting to separate the fight. Staff 3 had no concerns with how
staff intervened. Staff 3 did not have any concerns regarding staff
assaulting youth off camera.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/20/2024. Staff 4 was on campus and heard a call for extra
support for a fight. Staff 4 responded and had no concerns with
how staff were intervening and felt staff responded appropriately
to keep all the youth safe. Staff 4 did not have any concerns with
staff being inappropriate with youth at the facility.
Staff 5 was interviewed via teams meeting on 4/10/2024. Staff
5 responded to an extra staff assistance call for a fight with Youth
A, Youth B, and Youth C. Staff 5 reported staff intervened
appropriately, and he did not have any concerns with staff’s
interactions with youth.
Documents Reviewed:
4

• Michigan Department of Health & Human Services Incident
Report 177380233 dated 3/15/2024 was consistent with
staff and youth interviews.
• Osceola County Sheriff’s Office Report 67-2400437:
Interviews with staff and youth were consistent with
interviews conducted by consultant. Youth B made a
statement during interview with law enforcement “staff was
friendly in places where there were cameras but would
assault them when they were outside.”
• Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, Staff 4, and Staff 5’s personnel file:
There was no discipline. Staff 1 completed Aegis training
on 11/8/2023, Staff 2 is not trained in Aegis and was not
part of any restraints during the incident, Staff 3 completed
Aegis training on 11/8/2023, Staff 4 on 3/1/2024, and Staff
5 on 3/6/2024.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per interviews with youth
and staff, there was no indication of staff being assaultive outside
the facility where there are no cameras.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
It is recommended the facility address escorts are to be conducted
per the facilities trained model and not by holding/grabbing youths
clothing.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Health status assessment; notification; debriefing; reporting.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4163
Section (5) An agency will provide an incident report on a form prescribed
Description by the department for each incident involving the use of seclusion
or restraint. The initial report shall be submitted to the department
within 24 hours of the incident occurring. A final incident report
shall be submitted no later than 72 hours after the incident has
occurred.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Incident report was not approved within the 72 hours and two
restraints occurred that were not documented in MiSACWIS.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/20/2024. Youth A reported during the fight, an unknown staff
was moving her away. Youth A was unable to recall any details
as to how the staff was moving her or what the staff looked like.
Youth A reported Youth B was restrained during the fight however
was unsure who restrained Youth B or any details of the restraint.
5

Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/20/2024. Youth B reported she was restrained by Staff 5. Youth
B was unable to provide any details of the restraint she was in
with Staff 5 as Youth B reported she “blacked out”.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/20/2024. Youth C reported Staff 3 came to assist and restrained
Youth A. Youth C was unable to describe the restraint with Youth
A.
Youth D was interviewed via telephone on 4/15/2024. Youth D
reported Staff 5 came to assist with the situation and was
attempting to separate Youth B from Youth A and ended up
placing Youth B in a restraint in order to get her away from the
situation. Staff 5 walked Youth B back to the house. Youth A and
Youth C continued fighting and were hitting, kicking, and pulling
one another’s hair. Staff 3 came to assist. Staff 3 placed Youth A
in a restraint and walked Youth A away from the situation.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/28/2024. Staff 2 reported Staff 5 came to assist and was able to
get Youth B in a restraint.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/20/2024. Staff 3 reported when Staff 3 arrived Staff 5 had Youth
B in a benevolent restraint. Staff 3 reported the restraint was per
Aegis technique. Staff 3 reported she placed Youth A in a
benevolent restraint while the “taco” technique was used to get
Youth A and Youth C to release one another’s hair.
Staff 5 was interviewed via teams meeting on 4/10/2024. Staff
5 reported he secured Youth B in a level one restraint while Staff 2
used the finger technique to get Youth B to release Youth A’s hair.
Youth B continued while in the level one hold to try to go after
Youth A. Staff 5 transitioned Youth B from the level one hold to a
benevolent restrained and walked Youth B toward the vehicle.
Documents Reviewed:
• Eagle Village Residential Services Standard Operating
Procedures Therapeutic Holds: The RTS (or designee)
must submit the initial incident report to the department
within 24 hours after the incident occurred. This IR will be
approved within the state record system within 72 hours of
the incident.
6

• Michigan Department of Health & Human Services Incident
Report 177380233 dated 3/15/2024 regarding Youth C’s
restraint and was approved on 3/22/2024.
• Eagle Village Incident Report for Youth A dated 3/15/2024 at
6:51pm: Youth A was restrained by Staff 3. Staff 3 initiated a
benevolent restraint in the safety position due to the safety of
others.
• MiSACWIS incident reports were searched for Youth A’s
restraint on 3/15/2024 at 6:51pm and there was no restraint
incident report entered into MiSACWIS.
• MiSACWIS incident reports were searched for Youth B’s
restraint on 3/15/2024 during the altercation timeframe and
there was no restraint incident report entered into
MiSACWIS.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as incident report
177380233 was not approved in MiSACWIS within 72 hours of the
incident and there were no incident reports entered in MiSACWIS
or completed on the form prescribed by the department for Youth
A being restrained by Staff 3 or Youth B being restrained by Staff
5 on 3/15/2024.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code Staff to resident ratio
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4127
Section (3) The ratio formula for direct care workers shall correspond with
Description the institution’s purpose and the needs of the residents and shall
assure the continual safety, protection, and direct care and
supervision of residents.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Sherk house was out of ratio on 3/15/2024 when Staff 3 and Staff
5 responded to the assistance call leaving one staff at Sherk
house with six youth.
Investigation Interviews:
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/20/2024. Staff 3 was working in Sherk house and heard the call
for staff assistance at which time Staff 5 went to assist as Staff 5
was an extra staff in Sherk house and not counted into ratio. Two
to three minutes after Staff 5 went to assist there was another call
for additional staff. Staff 3 went to assist as she reported it was an
emergency and no other staff were available to respond. Staff 3
reported she was working in Sherk house and was counted as a
ratio staff. Staff 3 and Staff 6 were working with the six youth at
7

Sherk house however Staff 3 reported the youth in Sherk house
were calm at the time so she left the house for under fifteen
minutes to go assist leaving Staff 6 with six youth.
Staff 5 was interviewed via teams meeting on 4/10/2024. Staff
5 reported he was working in Sherk house and heard an
assistance call for extra staff. Staff 5 reported he was working
with Staff 3 and another staff which he could not recall who. Staff
5 went to assist and shortly after Staff 3 also came to assist.
Administrator was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
3/20/2024. Administrator reported the facility policy addresses
staff being able to leave to assist emergency calls as long as the
staff remains on campus and is not gone longer than fifteen
minutes. Administrator reported staff are trained to not be gone
longer than ten minutes to ensure they are back within the fifteen-
minute timeframe.
Documents Reviewed:
• Eagle Village Residential Services Standard Operating
Procedures Staffing Ratios: In order to maintain adequate
supervision of the youth in Eagle Village Residential the
following staff to resident ratios have been established. For
Mental Health Behavior Stabilization contracted homes, the
ratio during awake hours is 1 to 3 staff/resident. During sleep
hours a 1 to 6 staff/resident. For General Residential
contracted homes, the ratio during awake hours is 1 to 6
staff/resident. During sleep hours a 1 to 12 staff/resident.
• Eagle Village Residential Services Standard Operating
Procedures Program Statement: Youth Specialists to youth
ratio will not exceed 1:3 in Mental Stabilization/Behavioral
Stabilization Programs. Sherk House provides care to
Mental Health/Behavioral Stabilization girls ages 8-17.
• Eagle Village Incident report dated 3/15/2024 at 6:51pm for
Youth A: Staff 3 responded to an urgent extra staff call for
a youth-on-youth fight. Staff 3 talked with Staff 6 before
leaving Sherk house.
• Sherk House Schedule for 3/15/2024: from 4pm-10pm
there are three staff on shift including Staff 3, Staff 5, and
Staff 6.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as Staff 3, Staff 5, and Staff
6 were scheduled to be working in Sherk house on March 15,
2024, with six youth and Staff 3 and Staff 5 left to respond for
additional staff assistance call leaving Staff 6 with six youth. The
8

facilities staff ratio policy states the ratio during awake hours is
one to three staff/resident.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
